results.title: Earthquake in Turkey
results.material_description: digital screen recording of @matemusic1's TikTok post
results.brief_description: The dramatic collapse of a building in the aftermath of the recent earthquake that devestated Turkey and Syria - or is it? While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one turns out to be a building losing its scaffolding in Japan several years ago. Unlike traditional news media where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responds to disasters immediately but randomly. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings were able to post about their situation, alerting friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
results.description:
The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.
description_for_label:
The collapse of a building during the recent earthquake that devastated Turkey and Syria – or is it?

While posted alongside other videos of the event, this one is a building in Japan losing its scaffolding several years ago. Unlike traditional news media, where journalists are trained to check their facts, social media responses to disasters may be immediate but they can also be inaccurate. On the upside, some people who were trapped in collapsed buildings in the earthquake used social media to alert friends, family and rescuers to come to their aid. This video was removed a couple of days after being posted.

results.title: Theremin: An Electronic Odyssey documentary poster
results.brief_description: Poster for the documentary ‘Theremin: An Electronic Odyssey.’ This documentary explores the life of Leon Theremin, the inventor of an electronic synthesizer called the theremin, which uses motion to produce a sliding ethereal sound. After creating the instrument, Theremin is kidnapped by the KGB to work on inventions and surveillance technology. During his absence, the theremin becomes a popular instrument in film scores and through the performances of Clara Rockmore. In 1991, Theremin finally returns to the United States after his release.

results.brief_description: A memory film set in Belfast in 1981 during the IRA hunger strikes which led to the death and eventual martyrdom of Bobby Sands. Quiet and powerful, ‘81’ contains multiple points of view, alternating between Catholic and Protestant, women and men, youth and adults. What lingers and what haunts are the vivid stark images of the prisoners’ gaunt faces on the television sets; the determined set of Thatcher’s jaw; Bobby Sands’ eyes staring out from the posters glued haphazardly on the Belfast streets.

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: Everything under the sun [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Don Murray
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Italian.

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Italian.
